Epstein Flight Log 2001: The Royal Controversy Year

2001 is a pivotal year in the Epstein saga. It was the year Virginia Giuffre says she was trafficked to Prince Andrew - an allegation the Prince denies. The flight logs from 2001 have been scrutinized as potential evidence supporting or contradicting various accounts of what happened.

The Prince Andrew Connection

Virginia Giuffre has stated that she was flown on Epstein's plane multiple times in 2001, including trips involving Prince Andrew. A now-famous photograph shows Giuffre with Prince Andrew at Ghislaine Maxwell's London townhouse. Key points:
  • London trip: Giuffre alleges she was flown to London in 2001
  • Maxwell's residence: Where the photograph was taken
  • Prince Andrew's denial: He has consistently denied the allegations
  • Flight log evidence: Logs show relevant flights during the period
The 2001 flight logs have been examined as potential corroboration of various accounts.

2001 Flight Activity Overview

Beyond the flights connected to the Prince Andrew allegations, the 2001 logs show extensive activity:
  • New York-Palm Beach shuttle - Regular weekend flights
  • US Virgin Islands - Frequent access to Little Saint James
  • European destinations - London, Paris, and other cities
  • New Mexico - Trips to Zorro Ranch
The pattern of travel reflects Epstein's continued operation at full capacity.

Documented Passengers in 2001

The 2001 manifests show a range of passengers:

Virginia Giuffre: Appears in logs during the relevant period under her maiden name Roberts.

Ghislaine Maxwell: Present on numerous flights throughout the year.

Young women: Multiple first-name-only entries.

Staff and pilots: Regular operational personnel.

Professional associates: Business and social contacts.

Key 2001 Destinations

The 2001 flight logs document travel to:
  • Teterboro, NJ - Primary departure point
  • Palm Beach, FL - Florida mansion access
  • St. Thomas, USVI - Island gateway
  • London, UK - Including trips relevant to allegations
  • Paris, France - Regular European destination
  • Santa Fe, NM - Zorro Ranch visits
These destinations correspond to Epstein's property holdings and the allegations made by various parties.

Legal Significance of 2001 Logs

The 2001 flight records have been used in multiple legal proceedings:
  • Giuffre civil cases - Establishing her presence on flights
  • Maxwell criminal trial - Evidence of trafficking patterns
  • Prince Andrew settlement - Background for his 2022 settlement with Giuffre
  • Victim lawsuits - Supporting various claims
The logs serve as contemporaneous documentation of who was where and when.
The 2001 flight logs are among the most legally significant in the Epstein case. They document travel patterns during a period central to some of the most serious allegations made against Epstein and his associates. These records have been scrutinized in multiple legal proceedings and continue to be relevant as new cases and investigations emerge.
